result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Allen Millner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. Huber for work, child care, and treatment.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA Specimen and to pay mandatory DNA surcharge, AND all other costs and surcharges, at a rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 5-1-2015 until paid in full. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant. Defendant is advised that they may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if they meet the conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Make dilligent efforts to seek and maintain full time employment.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: This is to be STAYED to be used by the probation department as sanctions as deemed necessary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean Allen Millner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sean Allen Millner in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of (24) days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work, child care, and treatment. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
*Defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction, Conditioned time.  This is to be STAYED to be used by the probation department as sanctions as deemed necessary. 
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*Make diligent efforts to seek and maintain full time employment.
*Defendant ordered to provide DNA Specimen and to pay mandatory DNA surcharge, AND all other costs and surcharges, at a rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 5-1-2015 until paid in full.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Defendant is advised that they may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if they meet the conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165. 77(4).,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk jks

Defendant Sean Allen Millner in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46.  Defendant's wife is due to give birth in 2 weeks.  Defense counsel requests until April for next court date.  Court will allow the April date. jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: WALGREENS - 2275 N MAYFAIR RD.

Defendant Sean Allen Millner in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Sean Allen Millner in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
